description:
I believe the value for vlan_interface in the nova.conf file here : http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/starter/content/Nova_conf-d2s367.html

should be an eth device
title: wrong value for --vlan_interface in nova.conf in on starters guide

comments.content:
I believe the value for vlan_interface in the nova.conf file here : http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/starter/content/Nova_conf-d2s367.html

should be an eth device
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jjrp78

comments.content:
From http://wiki.openstack.org/FlagsGrouping

vlan_interface: This is the interface that VlanManager uses to bind bridges and vlans to.
(default: 'eth0')
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mjfork

comments.content:
This has been fixed in trunk:

http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/starter/content/Nova_conf-d2s367.html
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kbringard
